title: Easeout Weekly #13
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![CSS Leading Line Height](/images/uploads/leading-lineheight.jpg) [How to Tame Line Height in CSS](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-tame-line-height-in-css/) To truly understand the line-height property in CSS, we should learn about its origins in typography. This article takes us on that journey! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-tame-line-height-in-css/)
![Accessible image diagram](/images/uploads/accessible-images.png) [Accessible Images For When They Matter Most](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/accessible-images/) This article reviews the different types of images, looking at real-world examples of inaccessible public service announcements (PSAs), and discusses which elements matter most when critical messages need to reach everyone. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/accessible-images/)
![CMS Comparison Charts](/images/uploads/cms-with-cloudflare.png) [How to Make a Simple CMS With Cloudflare, GitHub Actions and Metalsmith](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-make-a-simple-cms-with-cloudflare-github-actions-and-metalsmith/) This tutorial takes us through using GitHub as a CMS to manage, version control, and store files, and also be the place for content editing. When edits occur, a series of automations will test, verify, and ultimately deploy content to Cloudflare. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-make-a-simple-cms-with-cloudflare-github-actions-and-metalsmith/)
![Styling Components In React Author Card](/images/uploads/styling-components-react.png) [Styling Components In React](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/styling-components-react/) This article takes use through the various ways we can style React components from using stylesheets to using external styling libraries. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/styling-components-react/)
![Dark Patterns alternative](/images/uploads/dark-patterns.png) [How To Convince Others Not To Use Dark Patterns](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/convince-others-against-dark-patterns/) Arguing that dark patterns are unethical is not enough on its own. We will also need to make the case to clients and colleagues that they are damaging to business. That’s what Paul has also written in his new Smashing book, “[Click](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/encouraging-clicks-book-pre-release/)”. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/convince-others-against-dark-patterns/)
![Virtual Gatsby Days: Speaker Announcement](/images/uploads/taelur_alexis.jpg) [Virtual Gatsby Days: Announcing Our Speakers](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/blog/2020-05-13-virtual-gatsby-day-speakers/) Virtual Gatsby Days is just around the corner! This two day single-track conference is a unique opportunity for the Gatsby community to come together online, develop their skills and expertise, and interact with each other and the Gatsby team. This article announces the first wave of speakers! [Read it ➡️](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/blog/2020-05-13-virtual-gatsby-day-speakers/)
![CSS Mask Diagonals](/images/uploads/jagged-edges.png) [Using CSS Masks to Create Jagged Edges](https://css-tricks.com/using-css-masks-to-create-jagged-edges/) Learn how to use CSS Masks to create some fun jagged edges in your apps! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/using-css-masks-to-create-jagged-edges/)
![React Logo](/images/uploads/react.jpg) [Dealing With Stale Props and States in React’s Functional Components](https://css-tricks.com/dealing-with-stale-props-and-states-in-reacts-functional-components/) A look at how closures can sometimes be the cause of stale props & state. And how we should approach this challenge. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/dealing-with-stale-props-and-states-in-reacts-functional-components/)
![Freddie Mercury in HTML and CSS](/images/uploads/freddie-mercury.png) [Freddie Mercury in HTML & CSS!](https://codepen.io/ricardoolivaalonso/full/zYvLYbY) A neat pure CSS Freddie Mercury by Ricardo Oliva Alonso. [Check it out ➡️](https://codepen.io/ricardoolivaalonso/full/zYvLYbY)
![Responsive Phone Background](/images/uploads/devices-pattern.png) [Turning a Fixed-Size Object into a Responsive Element](https://css-tricks.com/turning-a-fixed-size-object-into-a-responsive-element/) This article takes us through building a library to make fixed objects responsive. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/turning-a-fixed-size-object-into-a-responsive-element/)
![RedwoodJS with Tom Preston-Warner Episode](/images/uploads/redwoodjs.png) [RedwoodJS with Tom Preston-Warner](https://shoptalkshow.com/412/) Tom Preston-Werner talks about his latest project, RedwoodJS, and the decisions made about how it works, public APIs, how tied to Netlify RedwoodJS is, and why they're using Prisma. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/412/)
![TypeScript, React, Babel and Webpack Logos](/images/uploads/typescript-react-babel-webpack.jpg) [Setting TypeScript For Modern React Projects Using Webpack And Babel](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/typescript-modern-react-projects-webpack-babel/) In this tutorial, you'll learn how to efficiently set up TypeScript in a React Project while building a Money Heist Episode Picker App, exploring TypeScript, React hooks such as useReducer, useContext and Reach Router. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/typescript-modern-react-projects-webpack-babel/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
